name: Order of operations integers with no brackets or powers

skills.name: Use the order of operations to carry out calculations involving addition, subtraction, multiplication, and/or division

explanations.A: Doing multiplication first we get 15, then we need to + 4 = 19 and - 2 = 17
explanations.B: Not quite. I think you added the 5 and 4 before multiplying. We need to multiply the 3 and 5 together first
explanations.C: Not quite. I think you multiplied the 3 by the answer you get to the rest of the calculation. We need to do the 3 x 5 first
explanations.D: Not quite. I think you have subtracted 2 from 5 and then multiplied by 3.We need to do the 3 x 5 first, and then + 4 - 2

explanations.A: Not quite. You need to remember to use BIDMAS to calculate the answer.
explanations.B: Using BIDMAS we do the multiplication first, which gives 56. The calculation becomes 56 + 10 - 3, and as addition and subtraction are equal priority we work from left to right. 56 + 10 = 66, and 66 - 3 = 63
explanations.C: Almost, I think you have made a tiny error with your addition and subtraction. Just check your calculation
explanations.D: I think you did the 8 - 3 multiplied by 7 + 10. You need to remember to use BIDMAS to calculate the answer.

explanations.A: Multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations. Therefore 3 ✕ 5 - 2 + 4 = 15 - 2 + 4. When we are left with just additions and subtractions in the calculation we work left to right. 15 - 2 + 4 = 13 + 4 = 17.
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition in the order of operations (BIDMAS).
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).
explanations.D: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition in the order of operations (BIDMAS).
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).
explanations.D: Multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations. Therefore 8 ✕ 7 - 10 + 3 = 56 - 10 + 3. When we are left with just additions and subtractions in the calculation we work left to right. 56 - 10 + 3 = 46 + 3 = 49.

explanations.A: Multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations. Therefore 3 - 5 + 4 ✕ 2 = 3 - 5 + 8. When we are left with just additions and subtractions in the calculation we work left to right. 3 - 5 + 8 = -2 + 8 = 6.
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS). When adding on a positive number we would expect our answer to get less negative not more.
explanations.D: Not quite. I think you correctly chose to multiply first but then added incorrectly. Using a number line and marking on your starting number will help you deal with the negative in this calculation.

explanations.A: Be careful! We must make sure we follow the order of operations (BIDMAS) and that we only use each number once. Underline the calculation you are working on and write the next step on a new line.
explanations.B: Multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations. Therefore 8 - 7 + 10 ✕ 3 = 8 - 7 + 30. When we are left with just additions and subtractions in the calculation we work left to right. 8 - 7 + 30 = 1 + 30 = 31.
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS). We then work left to right when our calculation contains only additions and subtractions.
explanations.D: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).

explanations.A: Not quite. I think you correctly chose to multiply first but added incorrectly. Using a number line and marking on your starting number will help you deal with the negatives in this calculation.
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).If there is a multiplication then we must deal with that first.
explanations.C: Multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations. Therefore 3 - 5 ✕ 4 + 2 = 3 - 20 + 2. When we are left with just additions and subtractions in the calculation we work left to right. 3 - 20 + 2 = -17 + 2 = -15.
explanations.D: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).If there is a multiplication then we must deal with that first.

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).If there is a multiplication then we must deal with that first.
explanations.B: Multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations. Therefore 8 - 7 ✕ 10 + 3 = 8 - 70 + 3. When we are left with just additions and subtractions in the calculation we work left to right. 8 - 70 + 3 = -62 + 3 = -59.
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).If there is a multiplication then we must deal with that first. Subtraction is not commutative, 5 - 3 is not the same as 3 - 5 using a number line will help you deal with the negative in this calculation.
explanations.D: Not quite. Remember multiplication comes before addition and subtraction in the order of operations (BIDMAS).If there is a multiplication then we must deal with that first.

explanations.A: Not quite. Working out each calculation will help you see whose calculations are identical.
explanations.B: Not quite. Working out each calculation will help you see whose calculations are identical.
explanations.C: Adding two and then subtracting one is the same as subtracting one and then adding two. They both increase your original number by one. Therefore Tom is correct. Multiplication comes before addition in the order of operations (BIDMAS). 2 ✕ 1 will be the first step in both of Katie's calculations, therefore Katie is also correct.
explanations.D: Not quite at least one of them is correct. Working out each calculation will help you see whose calculations are identical.

explanations.A: Tom is correct as he has kept the correct signs (or operations) with the correct numbers. On both sides of the identity sign Tom has a +6, +4 and a -2. Doing these calculations in any order will always give you the same answer. Katie is incorrect as she has switched the numbers being multiplied. Multiplying 6 by 4 is not the same as multiplying 2 by 4.
explanations.B: Not quite. Working out each calculation will help you see whose calculations are identical.
explanations.C: Not quite. At least one of them is incorrect. Working out each calculation will help you see whose calculations are identical.
explanations.D: Not quite. At least one of them is correct. Working out each calculation will help you see whose calculations are identical.
